alert.note: Alert for Weld (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued June 12 at 8:59AM MDT until June 15 at 6:00PM MDT by NWS Boulder
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Denver has issued a Flood Advisory for the following rivers in Colorado... South Platte River near Kersey affecting Weld County. ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM THIS MORNING TO THURSDAY EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...South Platte River near Kersey. * WHEN...From this morning to Thursday evening. * IMPACTS...At 8.0 feet, The river is out of its banks and into fields and meadows. At 10.0 feet, Considerable lowland and meadow flooding occurs. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 8:30 AM MDT Monday the stage was 9.0 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 9.4 feet tomorrow evening. - Action stage is 8.0 feet. - Flood stage is 10.0 feet. &&
info.instruction: If you encounter a flooded roadway, turn around and find an alternative route. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov.
